net.hudup.core.data

Class RatingVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.RatingVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, TextParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ItemRating, UserRating

    public class RatingVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, TextParsable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a vector (an array) of ratings. As a convention, its is called rating vector. Recall that rating represented by Rating class contains following important information relevant to the event a user rates on an item
    1. Rating value represented by Rating.value is a double number that a user rates on an item.
    2. The date that a user rates on an item, represented by Rating.ratedDate. Of course it contains year, month, day, hour, minute, second, etc.
    3. A list of contexts that a user rates on an item, represented by Rating.contexts. Context is additional information related to user's rating, for example, place that user makes a rating, companion indicating the persons with whom user makes a rating such as alone, friends, girlfriend/boyfriend, family, co-workers.
    As a definition, a rating is called rated (user rated an item) if its rating value is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise such rating is called unrated. Note that rating does not specify user identification (user ID) and item identification (item ID). This aspect is very important, which derives two kinds of rating vector such as user rating vector and item rating vector. If this class is user rating vector, it contains all ratings of the same user on many items and so the internal variable id is user identification (user ID). If this class is item rating vector, it contains all ratings of many users on the same item and so the internal variable id is item identification (item ID). As a convention, the internal variable id is known as ID of rating vector.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • id

        protected int id
        If this class is user rating vector which contains all ratings of the same user on many items then, this internal variable is user identification (user ID). If this class is item rating vector which contains all ratings of many users on the same item then, this internal variable is item identification (item ID). As a convention, this variable is known as ID of rating vector.

      • ratedMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Rating> ratedMap
        This map contains all ratings of this rating vector. Each entry of this map has a key and a value. Value is rating represented by Rating class. If this class is user rating vector which contains all ratings of the same user on many items then, key is item identification (item ID). If this class is item rating vector which contains all ratings of many users on the same item then, key is user identification (user ID). As a convention, such key is called field id indicating both user id and item id, which is distinguished with regard that this rating vector is user rating vector or item rating vector. Therefore, every rating is associated with a field ID.

        public void fillForUnrated(double fillValue)
        For ratings which are unrated, this method sets their values by specified filling value. As a definition, a rating is called rated (user rated an item) if its rating value is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise such rating is called unrated.
        Parameters:
        fillValue - specified filling value which is used to fill in unrated ratings.

      • select

        public RatingVector select(ContextList contexts)
        Every rating specified by Rating has a context list. Context is additional information related to user's rating, for example, place that user makes a rating, companion indicating the persons with whom user makes a rating such as alone, friends, girlfriend/boyfriend, family, co-workers. Context A can be inferred from context B if:
        • Two contexts are totally equal (template and value are the same).
        • Two (context) templates are equal and context A has null value, it means that it is more generic than context B.
        • Template of context A can be inferred from specified template, it means that template of context A is more generic than template of context B.
        For example, context "December 2015" can be inferred from context "8th December 2015". This method returns a new rating vector derived from this rating vector so that the context list of such new vector can be inferred from the specified context list.
        Parameters:
        contexts - specified context list.
        Returns:
        new rating vector derived from this rating vector so that the context list of such new vector can be inferred from the specified context list.

      • toRoundValues

        public RatingVector toRoundValues()
        In case that ratings values are real numbers, this method make round of these values.
        Returns:
        new rating vector derived from this rating vector so that rating values of the new vector are rounded.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clearing this vector, which means that all ratings are removed from this vector.

      • newInstance

        public RatingVector newInstance(boolean sequence)
        Creating a new rating vector so that this rating vector plays a role of template. Note that such new vector is empty (which has no ratings) but its ID is the ID of this vector.
        Parameters:
        sequence - additional parameter guiding how to create the internal variable ratedMap. If it is true then, such internal variable containing all ratings will have built-in mechanism of sequence as a list.
        Returns:
        new vector so that it is empty (which has no ratings) but its ID is the ID of this vector.

        new vector so that it is empty (which has no ratings) but its ID is the ID of this vector.

      • count

        public int count(boolean rated)
        Counting for ratings which are rated or unrated according the parameter rated. As a definition, a rating is called rated (user rated an item) if its rating value is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise such rating is called unrated.
        Parameters:
        rated - if true, the method returns the number of rated ratings. Otherwise, the method returns the number of unrated ratings.
        Returns:
        the number of ratings which are rated or unrated according the parameter rated.

      • count

        public static int count(double[] row,
                        boolean rated)
        Given a row of rating values specified by the parameter row, this method counts for ratings which are rated or unrated according the parameter rated. As a definition, a rating value is called rated if it is not Constants.UNUSED; otherwise it is call unrated.
        Parameters:
        row - a row of rating values.
        rated - if true, the static method returns the number of rated value. Otherwise, the method returns the number of unrated values.
        Returns:
        the number of values which are rated or unrated according the parameter rated.

      • clone

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Rating> clone(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Rating> map)
        Deep cloning the specified map of ratings. Note that each rating in this map associated with a field ID (key). Field ID can be user ID or item ID, dependent on application.
        Parameters:
        map - specified map of ratings.
        Returns:
        cloned map of ratings.

      • transfer

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,RatingVector> transfer(Fetcher<RatingVector> fetcher,
                                                                     boolean sequence,
                                                                     boolean autoClose)
        This static method iterates all ratings via the fetcher of ratings and put such ratings to a new map. Note that fetcher is the interface for iterating each item of an associated collection.
        Parameters:
        fetcher - specified fetcher of ratings, represented by Fetcher interface.
        sequence - additional parameter guiding how to create the new map of ratings. If it is true then, such new map containing all ratings will have built-in mechanism of sequence as a list.
        autoClose - if true, the specified fetcher is closed after the transference is finished.
        Returns:
        new map contains fetched ratings.

      • clone2

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,RatingVector> clone2(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,RatingVector> map)
        Deep cloning the specified map of rating vectors. Each entry of this map is a pair of key and value. Value is a rating vector and key is ID of such rating vector.
        Parameters:
        map - specified map of rating vectors.
        Returns:
        cloned map of rating vectors.

      • select

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,RatingVector> select(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,RatingVector> map,
                                                                   ContextList contexts)
        Every rating specified by Rating has a context list. Context is additional information related to user's rating, for example, place that user makes a rating, companion indicating the persons with whom user makes a rating such as alone, friends, girlfriend/boyfriend, family, co-workers. Context A can be inferred from context B if:
        • Two contexts are totally equal (template and value are the same).
        • Two (context) templates are equal and context A has null value, it means that it is more generic than context B.
        • Template of context A can be inferred from specified template, it means that template of context A is more generic than template of context B.
        For example, context "December 2015" can be inferred from context "8th December 2015". This static method returns a new map of rating vectors derived from the specified map of rating vectors so that the context list of every rating vector of such new map can be inferred from the specified context list.
        Parameters:
        map - specified map of rating vectors
        contexts - specified context list.
        Returns:
        new map of rating vectors derived from the specified map of rating vectors so that the context list of every rating vector of such new map can be inferred from the specified context list.
